Manager Business Home Lending Melbourne East

Company Name Commonwealth Bank Company Location Melbourne, AU

Posted Date Posted 1 day ago Number of views 5 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

Manager Business Home Lending - Melbourne East
  • Based in Melbourne East
  • Join a team of Customer Obsessed professionals
  • Motivate and lead a team of Business Home Lending Specialists


See yourself as part of our team

Business Banking SME is proud to support a range of small to medium sized businesses across Australia. We partner with the businesses we work with and thrive when we're embedded in our local communities. Our innovative technology solutions provide invaluable support for our clients as we help them lead their businesses into the future. Our team is energised about what we do, what we've achieved and the momentum behind where we're headed.

Do work that matters

We're in the business of building relationships! As a Relationship Manager, you will provide meaningful solutions for a portfolio of clients. Understanding the specific needs and goals of your clients will help you to use your relationships to help them understand new opportunities. You'll use your insights, experience and expertise, along with a great range of innovative products and services, to help move businesses forward and grow our client base.

More Specifically, You'll
  • Develop, motivate and lead a team of Business Home Lending Specialists and Corporate Specialists
  • Act as a role model and coach the team in the Bank's values and People Capabilities
  • Achieve customer service excellence by resolving customer inquiries and/or complaints in a prompt, professional and caring manner and ensure customers are referred to appropriate specialists
  • Build positive and productive relationships between Local Business Banking (LBB), Regional and Agri Banking (RAB) and Corporate Financial Services (CFS) and facilitate regular One Commbank meetings
  • Manage sales, service and operational risk management processes performed by the team in accordance with the Bank's methodology to ensure all targets are met
  • Manage the sales pipeline to ensure the effective use of resources, meeting of targets and efficient and effective processing of leads.

To help us deliver a better future for business banking, you'll:
  • Demonstrated team leadership, development capabilities and sales management experience
  • Ability to display proven experience in observation, feedback and coaching on areas of improvement
  • Advanced commercial acumen, strong relationship management and influencing skills with a superior customer needs focus
  • Strong competence in risk and compliance, systems, process and product knowledge

Our culture of inclusion

The people, businesses and communities we serve are wonderfully diverse. To reflect this, we're committed to hiring a similarly diverse workforce. With a focus on inclusion, accessibility and flexibility, we'll support you at every stage of your career.

We value you and won't leave you hanging. Our advertising closes Tuesday 23rd October 2018 but expect to hear from us within a week of the closing date. Best of luck!

Talent Acquisition Advisor

Company Name RMIT University Company Location Melbourne, AU

Posted Date Posted 1 day ago Number of views 34 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

Talent Acquisition Advisor
Job no: 570487
Work type: Full time - Continuing/Permanent
Categories: Human Resources
  • Own and deliver an exceptional experience
  • New roles, new challenges, new opportunities
  • Awesome TA roles - add value and feel valued in a Global Uni.

Shaping students to “be ready for work and for life” and “be their best and belong” by attracting the most talented staff to the organisation.

RMIT is a Global University of technology, design and enterprise, which has a key mission to help shape the world through research, innovation, teaching and engagement. Responding to this and the increasing demand locally and internationally for high quality, relevant and accessible tertiary education. From a Talent Acquisition perspective this has led to a critical reforming of the team to ensure we deliver the best customer centric experience and service to students and industry partners alike, to enable them to “be ready for work and for life” and “be their best and belong” https://www.rmit.edu.au/about/our-strategy

The Talent Acquisition Team is reshaping, reforming and realigning to be positioned to attract, source and shape the RMIT Academic and Non- Academic staff of tomorrow and we are looking at everything we do and how we do it to be a TA function that leads the way.

The Role

As a Talent Advisor you will be key player in the team. Keen to partner with the business to attract and engage a great cast of academic and corporate talent to gain RMIT the recognition in the market as the best place to educate, teach, mentor, work and continue to learn and develop both professionally and personally.

About You

The ideal candidates will be outgoing and enthusiastic, with a genuine enthusiasm for sourcing great talent across multiple functions, disciplines and levels. You love making real connections and matching them with real opportunities. You will have some recruitment experience (minimum 6 months) and will be ready willing and eager to learn new skills and approaches in order to offer an exceptional recruitment service!
  • You rise to a challenge and are ready and eager to seize the opportunity to contribute in a fast pace environment which is changing and dynamic
  • You are quick thinking, adaptable and love variety
  • You are a willing learner ready to soak up the knowledge to sharpen your skills as a great recruiter and team player.

What the role offers you - the ultimate in opportunity
  • to be challenged, stretched, upskilled and share your skills and experience in a supportive, delivery focused, team-oriented environment
  • to be involved and grow professionally at a time of transformation and change at an organisational, functional and individual level
  • to make your mark by bringing your own talents and insights to the front in a complex, competitive customer focussed market where ideas are welcomed, and your voice will be heard
  • to work with an organisation - wide audience of customers both internally and externally, locally and internationally, on which to make a personal impact moving forward
  • to add value and feel valued in a new, vibrant and customer focussed service team


Qualifications

Relevant experience as a Talent Sourcing or Recruitment Specialist in the Tertiary sector OR similar environment or an agency recruiter keen to make an in-house move. Tertiary qualified in HR, Business or related area.

For further information please contact Angela Hayes on 0432668296 or visit yourcareer.rmit.edu.au and search using job reference number 570487. To apply please forward your detailed CV and cover letter by clicking on the Apply Link below.

Applications close at COB Wednesday 24th October 2018

RMIT is an equal opportunity employer committed to being a child safe organisation. We are dedicated to attracting, retaining and developing our people regardless of gender identity, ethnicity, sexual orientation, disability and age. Applications are encouraged from all sectors of the community.

#LI

Application close: 24 Oct 2018 11:55 PM AUS Eastern Daylight Time

[

Writer

Company Name Vanguard Australia Company Location Melbourne, Australia

New Posted Date Posted 12 hours ago Number of views 57 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

Vanguard Australia (VIA) has been helping investors achieve their long-term financial goals for over 20 years. Serving institutional and individual clients, and financial advisers, we offer investment solutions that are low-cost, diversified and robust through time. In this role you will be writing complex content for marketing communications for VIA’s Financial Advisor Services, Institutional and Retail channels. Communication channels may include web, print, e-mail, social media, mobile, or multimedia.


Duties and Responsibilities


1. Independently creates compelling content that articulates value propositions and key marketing messages for all communication channels in support of strategic initiatives and business as usual needs across all distribution channels (Institutional, Financial Advisor

Services & Retail).

2. Collaborates with International Marketing Services, creative teams and channel marketing, internal stakeholders from Distribution, Investment Management Group, Legal & Compliance and external vendors.

3. Develops content in the accepted Vanguard writing style. Ensures consistency of messages, compliance and branding across all communication pieces.

4. Maintains in-depth knowledge of investment markets, fundamentals of investing and superannuation, Vanguard managed funds and ETFs, Vanguard services and the competitive landscape.

5. Demonstrates initiative and creativity in identifying and meeting client needs. Influences the internal team to develop and execute creative, ‘out of the box’ ideas where appropriate.

6. Partners with creative team and clients to ensure that all internal and external client and production deadlines are met. Responds to edits and changes from reviewers with flexibility, while maintaining quality and accuracy.

7. Manages internal and external parties as appropriate, in order to deliver high quality collateral and campaigns.

8. Interviews and engages with senior colleagues across the business as required (e.g. for ‘ghost writing’ articles). Meets with and delivers presentations to project clients and management teams.

9. Ensures effective work flow of all marketing communication and collateral pieces.

10. Collaborates effectively with global and local subject matter experts to construct content that positions Vanguard as an educator and thought leader or as required by brand positioning.

11. Keeps up to date on key corporate and departmental initiatives, policies, procedures, and publishing workflows; reads financial news publications and competitive analyses to maintain awareness of important financial services, social media, and publishing trends and events.

12. Demonstrates understanding of Vanguard brand principles, acts as Brand champion and advocate.

13. Participates in special projects and performs other duties as assigned.


Qualifications

  • Bachelor degree or equivalent.
  • Minimum of 5 years’ experience in financial and investment writing/editorial and marketing communications.
  • Experience writing for digital channels and printed collateral.
  • Experience in asset management with strong product and superannuation industry knowledge.
  • Exceptional stakeholder management and influencing skills.
  • RG146 compliant.
  • Knowledge of compliance requirements.
  • Proven ability to translate complex investment principles into a ‘plain talk’ approach across all channels.
  • Sound research skills, outstanding writing and communications ability.
  • Excellent proofreading and editing skills.
  • Ability to be flexible and work under pressure to meet tight deadlines.


Vanguard is not offering visa sponsorship for this position.


The Vanguard culture is grounded in our core values of integrity, focus, and stewardship. It is that unique culture that drives the organization to be the best place to work and invest for Crew (our employees) and clients. Vanguard cultivates an environment of Inclusion where each individual is valued and recognized for who they are as well as their unique contributions, resulting in a highly engaged crew.


Vanguard values the diverse strengths, backgrounds, experiences and identities that crew bring to the organization. With a representative crew, we realize the full potential that unique perspectives have on making decisions in our clients’ best interests.

Job description

An exciting opportunity has arisen for an experienced Senior Marketing & Communications Advisor to join Calibre’s MarComms team in either of our Brisbane, Sydney, Melbourne or Perth office locations.

\xa0

Working closely with Sector Leaders, Executive and Corporate Services colleagues, and reporting to the General Manager ‒ Marketing & Communications, this role will help lead and implement the MarComms strategy across four focus areas, namely:

\xa0

  • Brand & Profile Development – ensure external and internal marketing and communication activities improve Calibre’s profile, brand awareness and positioning;
  • Client Experience (CX) and Engagement – ensure Calibre’s CX program is implemented for its key clients and support Calibre’s internal client management/key client program;
  • Client Relationship Management – work with business development teams to support strategic bids and optimise Calibre’s CRM; and
  • Build Capacity - enhance capability and knowledge across the business, and manage/support internal communications activities.

\xa0

Your role will involve managing the development and rollout of project campaigns from creative inception, budgeting, ROI analysis and delivery. Duties include, but are not limited to:

\xa0

  • External communications across news and announcements, media releases, advertising, thought leadership pieces, media coverage etc.
  • Website(s) and social media content updates, posts and general management.
  • Development, update and review of marketing collateral including brochures, project sheets and presentations.
  • Review of sponsorship or business development activities across events, conferences or other activities which support the four focus areas.
  • Coordination of photo and video shoots including script-writing and story-boarding.

  • Tertiary qualifications in Marketing, Communications or other relevant business degree. Postgraduate qualifications will be highly regarded.
  • Generalist knowledge with a broad skill set across marketing, communications, public relations, key client management/CX and CRMs.
  • Sound understanding and experience in digital marketing including website development, social selling, SEO, SEM, and online campaigns.

Desirable:

\xa0

  • InDesign/graphic design skills
  • Microsoft Office skills across Word, PPT etc with the ability to create or modify templates.

Company Name Spring Professional Company Location Melbourne, Australia

New Posted Date Posted 15 hours ago Number of views 61 views

Job description

Fantastic Opportunity for a CA/CPA qualified Accountant to join one of Victoria's leading building services companies as their Finance Manager.


About the Company

Our client is one of Victoria’s leading full-service building companies, specialising in in the fit-out and refurbishment of corporate offices and commercial environments. As they experience significant growth, they are sourcing a finance manager to oversee their internal finance department.


Your Role:

Reporting through to the directors of the business you will take on a leadership role with a 'hands-on approach'. The role itself will encompass all finance aspects including financial reporting, all taxation obligations, revenue reconciliations, budgeting and forecasting. You will be responsible for managing the finance team to ensure that work is properly allocated and completed in a timely and accurate manner.

Your responsibilities
\xa0

Responsibilities:
As a Finance Manager, you will manage the daily, monthly and annual financial and management reports, including:

  • Preparation of statutory accounts and financial reports with internal and external stakeholders
  • Manage and prepare the budgeting and forecasting process
  • Weekly Payroll
  • Tax Compliance (BAS, Payroll, Income tax)
  • Preparation and payment of Trust Income tax
  • Support the Directors in helping drive financial performance of the organisation
  • Help identify market opportunities through detailed analysis of competitors, pricing and KPIs
  • Ad-hoc tasks as required
  • Supervise and assist Accounts officer in performing budget and forecasting activities


What you need to succeed:

  • To be CA/CPA qualified is a must
  • A highly driven and accomplished hands-on finance professional
  • Previous experience in a construction industry is preferred but not essential
  • Previous experience using MYOB
  • Strong analytical, problem-solving and communication skills


This is a great chance to work for a fast growing business, as the Number 1 finance person, being part of the leadership team and working closely with the Directors of the business. You will gain broad exposure across Financial and Management Reporting, and help drive financial performance of the organisation.


If you feel that this is could be the next step in your career then get in touch with Paddy Courtney on 0427615057 or send your resume through to patrick.courtney@springprofessional.com.au .\xa0


Good luck!

Job description

V/Line, Victoria's largest regional passenger transport operator, has a proud history of serving its communities and customers through rail and coach services. As part of a constantly evolving industry, V/Line is responsible for over 80 train stations and maintenance of approximately 4,200 kilometres of rail track across Victoria. The organisation is committed to maintaining a high focus on safety and delivering excellent customer service, continually striving to improve the overall customer experience.


Reporting to the General Manager Asset Management and Performance, the Manager Planning and Network Closures is directly accountable for the development, coordination and execution of an effective and efficient Track Closure Master Schedule to achieve the optimal balance between train operations and access for network maintenance, major works and capital projects in accordance with V/Line’s and regulatory, practices, policies, standards and procedures. Whilst managing relationships with PTV, Metro, Yarra Trams, Vic Track, Vic Roads, local government and other community based organisations so as to minimise the impact of required track closures and occupations whilst providing the required access to track to execute the asset management plans.


Key responsibilities include developing specific implementation plans detailing all activities to be addressed during the execution of a closure or major occupation; coordinating corridor access, developing integrated work packages, resource and risk management plans for approved capital works projects and scheduled maintenance; managing a team of planners as well as representing Asset Management in negotiations relating to prioritisation of work activities within the Master Schedule.


To be successful in your application, you must have a strong background in rail asset management, with extensive and demonstrable experience in planning and scheduling. Formal qualifications in planning and scheduling are advantageous but not essential. The ideal candidate will have strong leadership and communication skills, the ability to manage complex issues across multiple stakeholders and the drive to achieve desired outcomes whilst coaching and mentoring a group of planners.


The salary for this position will be commensurate with experience. The selection process may include aptitude assessments, a behavioural event interview and a national probity (police) check. Please note that all candidates will be notified of the outcome of their application but unsuccessful candidates will not be provided with specific feedback.


To apply for this position, please click the ‘Apply for this Position Now’ below.

General Counsel and Company Secretary

Company Name Mercedes-Benz Australia Company Location Melbourne, Australia

Posted Date Posted 1 day ago Number of views 261 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

These opportunities don’t come about often…


This is a rare opportunity for a high performing individual looking for a challenging role with an iconic and aspirational global market leader. Based out of our head office in Melbourne, this is an exciting opportunity for you to further refine the legal function and develop the legal and company secretarial platform to support the future growth of the business, as it expands into new market segments.


In this high profile senior leadership position, you will report into the Regional General Counsel and act as General Counsel and Company Secretary across all of Daimler’s distribution businesses in the Australian and New Zealand markets: Mercedes-Benz Cars, Mercedes-Benz Vans and Daimler Truck and Bus.


Your key responsibilities will be to:

  • Manage the legal caseload and perform the company secretarial function
  • Develop legal and governance strategies, plans and actions to support the growth of the business
  • Develop, manage and lead the legal team
  • Provide independent strategic legal advice and counsel to the Board of Management, senior management and other stakeholders. Areas of law include corporate, commercial, contract, consumer, trade practices, product liability, litigation, competition/antitrust, franchising, intellectual property, data protection and mergers and acquisitions
  • Take a lead role in negotiations with business partners, public authorities and other external parties and represents Daimler’s interests in lobbying and industry activities
  • Identify, evaluate and address issues of legal risk
  • Assist with reviews, audits and investigations
  • Support the office of the Regional General Counsel of Legal Asia Pacific to coordinate, communicate and implement regional as well as Daimler Legal headquarters’ initiatives


The ideal candidate will have a strong grounding in corporate and commercial law and have extensive experience (7 – 10 years) in a diverse fast-paced environment gained either in a large global organisation and/or in a top tier law firm. You will have current admission to practice law in Australia and hold an Australian practising certificate (or eligibility to immediately obtain one). You will be comfortable with leading legal operations across several companies and jurisdictions as well confident in drafting, reviewing, negotiating and advising on a wide range of legal documents and topics. Your communication skills (both written and verbal) will be your biggest asset as will the ability to adopt a pragmatic and level-headed approach to provide timely advice and support to the business whilst acting with a high level of integrity and professional accountability. You will have the ability to influence and negotiate at all levels and manage complex stakeholders relationships (board level). You will ensure best practice corporate governance and take a pro-active approach to legal risk management. Your strong leadership skills will ensure that you develop and inspire your team to top performance. It goes without saying that you will have the ability to think critically and strategically and the ability to understand business needs and work collaboratively with stakeholders to provide solutions. Naturally, there will be peak periods and as such, the ability to deliver a high standard of work under tight timeframes will be critical. A Masters of Law (LLM) and company secretarial qualifications would be highly regarded but not essential, as would any automotive industry experience.


To be considered, please submit a cover letter and resume via the link by COB Thursday, 25th October.

Bush Heritage Australia, a national leader in landscape-scale conservation, is seeking a professional HR and OH&S Officer.

\xa0

Our vision of Healthy Country, protected forever sees us where we are needed most: in areas of high conservation value with low levels of protection. With the help of our donors, we protect and help manage 6.2 million hectares of land across the country. About the opportunity:
Resource Management strive to have the right people engaged on the right projects, aligning abilities and career aspirations to client demand and supporting Deloitte's strive for client service excellence. In doing so, Resource Management supports the Assurance and Advisory (A&A) practice business by providing a balance between its decisions that impact our people, our clients and our operational performance.

The objective of the A&A Resource Management Consultant role is to work within the Resource Management team to support effective strategic resource planning across the A&A business.

The Consultant is responsible for the allocation of Assurance and Advisory resources across client engagements with a focus on ensuring optimal staff utilisation, exceptional client service, employee engagement and retention, and engagement profitability. Additionally, the Resource Consultant will play a key role in data analysis and reporting.

Key duties include:

  • To act as a Trusted Advisor and key Resource Management point of contact for the assigned portfolio
  • Managing resource conflict/requirement resolution process, providing appropriate solutions to staffing issues and engaging proactively with stakeholders to mitigate impacts of movements and changing client needs
  • Working with the Resource Management team leader and business stakeholders to appropriately influence decision making
  • Ensure timely identification of issues and involve senior team members as appropriate to achieve resolution.
  • Build and maintain a thorough understanding of capability, career aspirations, interests and skills for all staff up to Senior Analyst level within portfolio
  • Instigate forward planning of portfolios for recurring work, and career advancement
  • Onboard new starters providing an introduction to RM systems, processes and scheduling approach
  • Responsible for graduate & vacationer program resourcing, ensuring diverse industry/engagement experiences
  • Preparing interpret and analyse key Resource Management metrics, drawing actionable insights


About you:

 Personal Attributes

  • Ability to build relationships, consult and influence key stakeholders
  • Highly motivated, confident and solutions focused
  • Highly-organised with strong attention to detail
  • Strong listening and analytical skills necessary to resolve intricate staffing issues
  • Ability to prepare, interpret and analyse financial data and reports
  • Ability to work in a fast paced environment, deal with ambiguity and changing/conflicting priorities, and cope with a constantly changing landscape.
  • Ability to work with and respect confidential and personal information
  • Confidence dealing with staff of all levels
  • Effective time management, actioning and delivering workload with an appropriate sense of urgency


Technical:

  • Understanding of professional services environment with knowledge of resource management and career development.
  • Microsoft Excel - Intermediate to Advanced
  • Prior experience using a Resource Management or Project Scheduling application
  • Familiarity with an Assurance business is preferable but not essential
  • Understanding of project management methodologies and life cycles


About us: Deloitte Culture
We pride ourselves on our team of diverse, high performing Deloitte Professionals who are talented, supportive, inclusive and social - and who are at the heart of our success. Our aim is to ensure that all our people feel comfortable to bring their whole selves to work, and as a result, create a workplace that encourages the true spirit of 'And different'.

From day one at our firm you'll be considered part of the Deloitte community and our development and career progression framework will help you develop the skills and capabilities you need to succeed - in every sense of the word.

By applying to this job you will be assessed against the Deloitte Global Talent Standards. We've designed these standards to provide our clients with a consistent & exceptional Deloitte experience globally.

BMS Project Engineer | Commissioning & Applications
Melbourne/Victoria

Innovative company – Specialists in BMS Controls & Building Automation

My client offers up to date technologies resulting in resourceful and operative building solutions whilst maintaining high standards of comfort. They are a specialist, boutique style BMS & Building Automation Company who deal with a lot of repeat business enhancing their excellent reputation across Victoria.

Due to demand they are actively looking for a senior BMS Project Engineer to join their successful team in Melbourne.

Duties And Responsibilities
  • Onsite commissioning, development & programmin.g
  • Integration of BMS Controls using Lonworks, Bacnet or Modbus.
  • Coding, Optimisation writing functions of the job.

  • BMS knowledge is a must – Ideally 5 years+ experience.

Pre & Post Sales Consultant

Company Name GlobalX Company Location Melbourne, Victoria, Australia

Posted Date Posted 2 days ago Number of views 21 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

Generous Base + Super + uncapped comms.


The Australian legal and conveyancing industries are rapidly transitioning to digital workspaces and GlobalX’s award-winning workflow software is leading the way.


Growth and the recent launch of new products have created an exciting new opportunity within the national sales team for a driven software sales specialist to spearhead pre and post initiatives for strategic client acquisition.


If you have a successful career selling enterprise software and just as comfortable having technical conversations with IT professionals as you are pitching to a boardroom of senior executives, then we would like to hear from you.


You will be based in our Melbourne CBD office and be part of a cutting-edge company providing best of breed digital disruption technologies.


What you will be doing:


  • Spearheading the acquisition of strategic target accounts
  • Lead negotiations, coordinate complex decision-making process, and overcome objections to capture new business opportunities.
  • Understand client requirements through strategic consulting and needs assessment, and presenting proposals
  • Promoting our next generation of B2B software integrations, but selling the benefits in business terms and problem solving, not technical jargon
  • Managing client and internal stakeholders in post-sale technology implementations
  • Work with our internal integration development team to create a pipeline of client integration work, and manage your client’s expectations of the delivery schedules.
  • Work with technology partners to create an effective solution for the client
  • Identify and develop new strategic technology alliances
  • Deliver the highest standard of service to customers to achieve maximum customer satisfaction.


What you can expect:\xa0


  • Generous base salary + uncapped monthly commissions
  • Joining a market leader that is disrupting through technology
  • Dynamic and fast paced culture;
  • Collaborative and modern working environment
  • Investment in professional development
  • The opportunity to take on more responsibility - brilliant career growth opportunity
  • Great office location in the heart of the Melbourne CBD


What you will have:


  • Minimum 5+ years of relevant sales experience with enterprise software
  • Tertiary qualifications within the Business, Information Technology and/or Legal field would be advantageous
  • A knowledge of what API’s and B2B software integrations entail, and what possibilities they offer for automation and reducing manual exertion
  • Excellent presentation, communication and negotiation skills
  • Proven experience with building and maintaining relationships with stakeholders
  • Demonstrate sales success and exceeding sales targets
  • A current and valid Australian Drivers Licence
  • Proof of Right to work in Australia


If you think the above is your next career step, then don't hesitate to apply for this position.


No agencies please
